progression_balancing.description:
A system that can move progression earlier, to try and prevent the player from getting stuck and bored early.
A lower setting means more getting stuck. A higher setting means less getting stuck.

accessibility.description:
Set rules for reachability of your items/locations.
Locations: ensure everything can be reached and acquired.
Items: ensure all logically relevant items can be acquired.
Minimal: ensure what is needed to reach your goal can be acquired.

priority_locations.description: Prevent these locations from having an unimportant item

minimum_resource_pack_amount.description: The minimum amount of resources available in a resource pack

maximum_resource_pack_amount.description: The maximum amount of resources available in a resource pack

duplicate_items.description:
Adds duplicates of items to the item pool (if configured in Filler items). These will be selected alongside
Resource Packs (if configured). Note that there are not many progression items, and selecting Progression may
produce many of the same duplicate item.

filler_item_types.description: Determines whether to use Resource Packs, Duplicate Items (as configured), or both.

island_frequency_locations.description: Sets where frequencies for story islands are located.

island_generation_distance.description: Sets how far away islands spawn from you when you input their coordinates into the Receiver.

expensive_research.description: Makes unlocking items in the Crafting Table consume the researched items.

progressive_items.description: Makes some items, like the Bow and Arrow, progressive rather than raw unlocks.

big_island_early_crafting.description:
Allows recipes that require items from big islands (eg leather) to lock earlygame items like the Receiver, Bolt,
or Smelter. Big islands are available from the start of the game, however it can take a long time to find them.

paddleboard_mode.description:
Sets later story islands to in logic without an Engine or Steering Wheel. May require lots of paddling. Not
recommended.

death_link.description: When you die, everyone dies. Of course the reverse is true too.
